critique: The document establishes a board to investigate a labor dispute between Pan American World Airways and its employees. It aims to prevent interruption of interstate commerce. There's no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It seems to expand executive power by creating a board, has a moderate intervention in economic regulation by preventing changes to the conditions of the dispute, and is neutral on social inclusion. It also seems to favor federalism by intervening in a local issue.
